oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Physiology and Pharmacology of the Postpartum Cow and Retained Fetal Membranes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bretzlaff, Katherine
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Retained fetal membranes
endometritis
involution
cyclicity
fertility
reproductive performance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Retained fetal membranes (RFM) in dairy cows are frequently associated with postpartum endometritis, delayed involution, delayed onset of cyclicity, and reduced reproductive performance. Numerous reports and recommendations for the treatment of RFM have been published, yet the search continues for a method to prevent the occurrence of the condition or at least reduce its effect on fertility.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1987; 71-76
